headline: Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC) Reports Q1 In Line With Expectations
summary: Freight transportation company Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales were flat year on year at $2.99 billion. Its GAAP profit of $3.31 per share was 23% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Norfolk Southern reaffirms annual forecast, tops first-quarter revenue estimates
summary: (Reuters) -U.S. railroad operator Norfolk Southern reaffirmed its annual forecast after topping first-quarter revenue estimates on Wednesday, on the back of increased volume in intermodal freight transport.  Container imports to the United States hit record highs in January and February as companies rushed to bring in goods early in the year fearing price hikes from President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, which helped intermodal volume at railroads such as Norfolk Southern.  Norfolk's revenue from intermodal shipping, which involves transporting goods via two or more means of transportation, was up 2% from a year earlier at $760 million.

Norfolk's revenue from intermodal shipping, which involves transporting goods via two or more means of transportation, was up 2% from a year earlier at $760 million.

headline: Norfolk Southern: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: ATLANTA (AP) — Norfolk Southern Corp. NSC) on Wednesday reported first-quarter profit of $750 million. On a per-share basis, the Atlanta-based company said it had net income of $3.31.

headline: Norfolk Southern reports first quarter 2025 results
summary: Norfolk Southern Corporation (NYSE: NSC) announced Wednesday its first quarter 2025 financial results. For the quarter, revenue was $3.0 billion, income from railway operations was $1.1 billion, operating ratio was 61.7%, and diluted earnings per share were $3.31.
